fig.title: Common map hierarchy using topicref elements
fig.p: The following code sample illustrates a simple map organizing several topics about the software product ExampleToolBuilder. The initial topicref that refers to setup.dita uses the collection-type attribute to indicate that the order of topics in that section is important.
fig.codeblock: <map> <title>ExampleToolBuilder version 1.2.3</title> <topicref href="setup.dita" collection-type="sequence"> <topicref href="prerequisites.dita"/> <topicref href="installing.dita"/> <topicref href="validating.dita"/> </topicref> <topicref href="everyday-use.dita"> <!-- ... --> </topicref> <topicref href="troubleshooting.dita"> <!-- ... --> </topicref> </map>

draft-comment.author: Kristen J Eberlein
draft-comment.p: I think this topic should have lots of examples that demonstrate what can be done by setting attributes. The topicref element is core (and unique) to DITA. Originally, the topic made reference to collection-type and linking. Try and illustrate the most important base behaviors.
Need examples that use non-DITA references.

example.draft-comment: Significantly updated the initial "simple" example, and mace collection-type into that example. Not sure how best to add examples of other attributes -- the most common way I see linking used is with relationship tables, but it feels odd to have code examples in topicref that are really highlighting the linking behavior of reltable.
